original: Mossberg, Karl Vilhelm Robert, civilingenjör, direktör, Norrköping, f. 12/10/94 i Gävle av brandchefen Gustaf Robert M. o. Esther Amalia Bengtsson. G. 1. 21 m. Maud von Kru-senstjerna; 2. 38 m. Ann Mari Klae-ning. Barn: Allan f. 22, Rickard 23. — Stud:ex. i Norrköp. 13, ’avg:ex. fr. KTH (V) 17. Ing:bitr. v. byggn:arb. 16, bitr. ing. v. östra väg- o. vatten-byggn :distr. 17, anst. v. A-B Vatten-byggn :byrån 18-19, f örst’e asisist. v. KTH lab, f. byggn:statik 19-25, sekr. i Sv. betongfören. o. red. f. tid skr. Betong 20-26, e. ing. v. Sthlms stads byggn:nd 20-26, lär. v. ett flert. av Sthlms- byggn :ing :fören. o. Samf. f. hemh :vård anordn. byggmäst :kurser 21-28, vik. fastigh:reg:för. 23-24, byggn :tekn. sakk. v. Banik A-B Norden 24-27, byggmästarerättigh. 25, konsult. ing. in. hus- o. brobyggn :facket 25-33, vik. lektor i byggn:lära, -ritn., -mek. o. grafostatiik v. tekn. elem :isk. i Norrköp. 26, sakk. f. vissa utredn. åt riksd. rev. 31 o. 32, vik. verkst. dir. f. Norrköp. stadshyp :fören. o. Norrköp. bosit :kreditfören. 32, 33 o. 34, verkst. dir. f. Norrköp. stadshyp :fören. fr. 34 o. f. Norrköp. bost :kreditfören. fr. 37. I Sthlm l’ed. av stadsfullm. 27-31, av kyrkoråd i Kungsholms förs. 26-34, av kyrkofullm. 32-34’, rev. i hamnstyr. 28, led. av gatund 29-32, v. ordf. i Sthlms stads idr:styr. 29-32, led. av utskänk-n :komm. 28-31, i Norrköp. styr:-led. i Norrköpings bost :kreditfören., i Östergötlands östra landst :förb., i Norrköpings luftv :fören., i luftsk:-fören. samt i fl. idr :sammanslutn. Res. t. Tyskl., Österr., Schweiz o. Holl. 22, 25, 30. Medl. av Frimurarorden o. Coldin. Skr.: ett stort antal uppsatser i tekniska frågor o. om skid-backsbyggn. i in- o. uti. facktidskr. m. m. Hobby: friluftsliv. LandstSM, Sthlms, Kronob. o. Östergöt 1. östra IstfSM, Landst :ofi. riksförb. SM, Skid-främj. SM, Riksidr:f’örb. ftjt i G, Sv. vskidförb. ftjplak i S m. m.
translated: Mossberg, Karl Vilhelm Robert, engineer, director, Norrköping, b. 12/10/94 in Gävle to fire chief Gustaf Robert M. and Esther Amalia Bengtsson. Married 1. in 1921 to Maud von Kru-senstjerna; 2. in 1938 to Ann Mari Klae-ning. Children: Allan b. 1922, Rickard b. 1923. Completed high school in Norrköping in 1913, graduated from KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) in 1917. Worked as assistant engineer at construction work in 1916, assistant engineer at the Eastern Road and Water construction district in 1917, employed at A-B Water Construction Office from 1918-1919, and then as an assistant at KTH laboratory for building statics from 1919-1925. Secretary at the Swedish Concrete Association and editor of the magazine "Betong" from 1920-1926, civil engineer at Stockholm City Building Council from 1920-1926, teacher at several Stockholm Building Engineering Association and Society for Home Care arranged building master courses from 1921-1928, temporary property registry official from 1923-1924, building technical advisor at Banik A-B Norden from 1924-1927, obtained building master's rights in 1925, consulting engineer in the house and bridge construction sector from 1925-1933, temporary lecturer in building construction theory, drawing, mechanics, and graphic statics at a technical high school in Norrköping in 1926, expert for certain investigations to the Parliament's Audit Board in 1931 and 1932, temporary managing director for Norrköping City Mortgage Association and Norrköping Housing Credit Association in 1932, 1933, and 1934, managing director for Norrköping City Mortgage Association from 1934 and for Norrköping Housing Credit Association from 1937. Member of Stockholm City Council from 1927-1931, member of the Church Council in Kungsholm parish from 1926-1934, member of the Church Council from 1932-1934, auditor in the port board in 1928, member of the street board from 1929-1932, vice-chairman of Stockholm City Sports Council from 1929-1932, member of the liquor licensing committee from 1928-1931, board member of Norrköping City Mortgage Association, Eastern Östergötland County Federation, Norrköping Air Defense Association, Air Sports Association, and several sports associations. Traveled to Germany, Austria, Switzerland, and the Netherlands in 1922, 1925, and 1930. Member of the Freemasons and Coldin. Wrote a large number of papers on technical matters and ski slope construction in domestic and international technical journals, among others. Hobby: outdoor activities. Member of the Swedish National Ski Team, Stockholm, County and Eastern Östergötland in Nordic skiing, Swedish Ski Association gold medal in skiing relay, National Sports Confederation, Ski Promotion, Swedish Sports Confederation gold medal in G, Swedish Ski Association silver plaque, etc.

organization.name: Eastern Road and Water Construction District
